channel.title: tir
channel.description: "Today I Read:" a collection of the little things you read each day. Cherish them!

item.title: Against Demolition
item.description: About Geller I, which was quietly demolished despite its historical significance.

item.title: Lab-Leak Theory and the "Asiatic" Form
item.description: Juxtaposing "oriental" and "asiatic," citing Lye, in the context of covid origin theories. cc "'Chinese Virus,' World Market."

item.title: New Left Review
item.description: Case for working-class intellectualism and defense of Foucault against accusations of neoliberalism.

item.title: Radical Narcissist
item.description: Nausicaa Renner can't stand a podcaster, and apparently disagrees with Dombek on narcissism.

item.title: Why coding interviews aren't all that bad
item.description: Does what it says on the tin. Should take a harder line on coding interviews being, in truth, somewhat realistic.

item.title: A primer on functional architecture
item.description: Classes don't necessarily map 1:1 to interactions, since interactions often occur between classes or touch several. That's why UIs don't map 1:1 to collections.

item.title: In the Kingdom of the Blind...
item.description: Unusually polemical for AoP. Discusses a disillusioning return to an irreversably altered "rural."

item.title: A "Theatre" Piece: The Artist
item.description: "Artist, the world is not so simple, it is not all black and white!"

item.title: Shades of Black
item.description: Patches for secret Air Force programs, annotated. "The phrase Oderint Dum Metuant is usually associated with Caligula... It translates as 'Let them hate so long as they fear.'"

item.title: Two Lives, Simultaneous and Perfect
item.description: On Rohmer. Invokes Bataille like Baudrillard reviews Santa Cruz: a nostalgia for the old prohibitions. Bataille does it better.

item.title: APIs are about Policy
item.description: APIs can be too basically about data; they need to enforce constraints (e.g. permissions, consistency)
